channel.title: Python on Unqualified Success
channel.description: Recent content in Python on Unqualified Success

item.title: Images Like This
item.description: The General Idea Given a set of images, find the ones that are most similar to a set of examples. More Specifically Given a dataset, comprising image features extracted using a pre-trained model, and given also the row identifiers for a subset of the data, representing the kind of images to find, create a TRAINING set of the specified rows and a TEST set of all remaining rows, then train a binary SVM classifier to identify images in the TEST set, which are similar to those in the TRAINING set.
